creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: Tassel with red fringe and sumak embroidered stem with motif of birds or arrows in red and gold. Tagged 'Borlas.'
text: This is an example of a royal red tassel, modeled after those worn by the Inka emperor as part of his crown. Tassels such as these were also worn by local indigenous lords well into the colonial period, and they still appear in festival dress to this day.
title: Tassel
